casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Mauricio ACOSTA-RAMIREZ, also known as Mauricio Ramirez-Acosta, Defendant-Appellant. No. 10-50442

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Feb. 15, 2011. Joseph H. Gay, Jr., Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Western District of Texas, San Antonio, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Wesley David Lloyd, Ñaman, Howell, Smith & Lee, P.L.L.C., Waco, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Before HIGGINBOTHAM, GARZA, and ELROD, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Mauricio Acosta-Ramirez (Acosta) has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Acosta has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no non-frivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from fur*678ther responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
